lexUnit.name: discerning.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or showing good judgement.

sentence.text: Increased awareness of ` green " issues , together with fierce competition , means consumers are more discerning about the environmental impact of the products they buy .

AIthough the three theories are engaged in a debate over the role of services in the economy and whether or not this represents the arrival of post-industrialism , they are discerning in their use of evidence and the points on which they engage one another .
They merely became more discerning in the façade they showed to the public .
On September 14 and 15 the staff and friends of Greenbank hold a big sale of unusual bulbs for discerning gardeners .
Discerning photographers will appreciate the quality of results possible from the f2.8 Zeiss lens .
Viola 's right leg ( stockinged ) and a frizz of her pubic hair next to his would show the discerning viewer what was going on .
A superb choice for the discerning holidaymaker .
The discerning reader will have noticed a distinct lack of mention of the planets among his predecessors ; they were lost amidst the mass of the stars .
Full football kit for a discerning 10-year-old will probably cost parents about £40 .

A young Dominican , Tommaso Caccini , embarrassed more discerning members of his order when , from his pulpit in December 1614 , he lampooned Galileo , and all mathematicians , as magicians and enemies of the faith .
Wallis was also a discerning collector .
Formentera is a haven for the more discerning tourist who wants sun and sea in a tranquil setting .
The acquisition is well-timed to take advantage of the continuing growth in demand for mineral water throughout Britain and Europe by discerning customers .
But sales were waning because the discerning customer found the contamination levels in the product unacceptable .
Sadly , she would have to be very discerning .
Although we offer holiday packages , we tend to find that the Citalia holidaymaker is often more discerning .
Customers were becoming much more discerning -- interested not just in price , but quality of products .
prepare detailed specifications of plant items and thereby become a discerning and knowledgeable purchaser of equipment and services ;
To find myself in the company of so many eminent , discerning and open-minded independent shopkeepers , affords me pleasure beyond expression .
Today 's consumers are sophisticated , discerning and demand quality products with real taste and flavour .
